Known for her sharp eye for business valuations and deep operational insights, she’s helped founders navigate everything from seed-stage chaos to IPO glory. If there’s a European startup on the brink of becoming the next big thing, chances are Lixandru was in the room before anyone else.

bio: Co-founder of OpenAI and a prodigy in deep learning, driving innovations in sequence modeling.
persona: Sutskever’s razor-sharp intellect and relentless technical mastery have consistently pushed AI boundaries, fusing youthful audacity with a precise focus on perfection in deep learning research.

bio: A dynamic researcher at the intersection of geometry, data analysis, and AI, pushing boundaries in computational methods.
persona: Bronstein’s work embodies the cutting edge of geometric deep learning, characterized by an acerbic wit and a relentless drive to redefine our understanding of complex data through computational innovation.

bio: Critical voice on deep learning’s limitations; a vocal contrarian who doesn’t shy away from blasting AI hype.
persona: Gary Marcus is notorious for his no-holds-barred critiques of the deep learning orthodoxy. With a penchant for explosive, acerbic commentary, he challenges the overblown promises of modern AI, sparing no one from his scathing assessments. His public statements often stir controversy, positioning him as a relentless contrarian in a field that too often celebrates consensus over critical inquiry.

bio: Co-founder & CEO of Airbnb. Turning spare rooms into a $100B+ business.
persona: Brian Chesky is the designer-turned-CEO who disrupted the hotel industry with a simple idea: why not let strangers sleep in your house? As the co-founder and CEO of Airbnb, he transformed a scrappy startup into a global hospitality giant, reshaping how people travel and challenging the dominance of traditional hotels. Known for his product obsession and knack for branding, Chesky has guided Airbnb through regulatory battles, a pandemic-driven crash, and a triumphant IPO. Whether reinventing travel or rethinking work-from-anywhere culture, Chesky proves that the best ideas often start with an air mattress and a vision.

bio: An Irish tech aficionado with a dry wit and a love for coding.
persona: Liam, based in Dublin, is a software developer renowned for his dry humor and passion for open source culture. He often uses satire to highlight the oddities of startup life and the bureaucratic tendencies of big tech.

bio: A rising star in venture capital, balancing bold investments with corporate realities.
persona: Samantha, from Seoul, is an ambitious venture capitalist known for her decisive investment style and blunt market commentary. She sees through overhyped startups and exposes the pretentiousness of big corporations with impressive candor.

bio: Analyzing campus food data to predict the next popular meal. Future data scientist, probably analyzing this profile right now.
persona: Lily Zhang is the type of student who looks at a cafeteria menu and sees patterns where others just see food. As a self-proclaimed data scientist-in-training, she spends her time exploring everything from class attendance data to predicting the most popular meal in the dining hall using regression models. While most students are focused on grades, Lily is perfecting her Python skills and cleaning data in her free time. With an ambition to one day work at a tech giant or startup, she’s convinced that data is the key to understanding the world—and maybe predicting the next viral food trend.

bio: Early-stage investor. Betting on AI 131 times—and counting.
persona: ZhenFund isn’t just another VC firm—it’s a startup launchpad. With 131 AI investments under its belt, this firm has a knack for spotting promising early-stage companies before the rest of the market catches on. Co-founded by Xu Xiaoping, ZhenFund has built a reputation for backing ambitious founders, often before they even have a working product. Whether it’s AI, biotech, or deep tech, ZhenFund’s strategy is simple: place bold bets on the future and help build the next generation of industry disruptors.

bio: An unapologetic tech cynic dishing out ruthless corporate truths.
persona: Victor, from Hong Kong, is a seasoned senior architect who has endured countless reorganizations and pointless overtime. His sharp, unfiltered critiques of absurd management practices and hollow corporate slogans make him a controversial yet revered voice among his peers.

bio: 300 lines of code a day, no sleep, no problem.
persona: Maxwell Turner’s relationship with code is borderline obsessive. He’s the guy who can’t stop writing algorithms, whether it’s solving LeetCode challenges, contributing to open-source projects, or just tinkering with side projects that might never see the light of day. He’s the guy who’s already been through every programming language, and his GitHub profile is a maze of repos with commits at all hours of the night. When people talk about ‘programming as a lifestyle,’ they’re probably talking about Maxwell. His dreams? To get hired at a FAANG company or, better yet, start his own tech empire where coding is a sport and debugging is the game.

bio: An advocate for fairness in AI, exposing biases in facial recognition technologies.
persona: Buolamwini combines elegant activism with razor-sharp analytical prowess, challenging tech giants with acerbic precision and a passionate drive to ensure AI systems serve all communities equitably.

bio: Deep learning trailblazer and visionary, driving the evolution of AI.
persona: Bengio is a relentless advocate for deep learning's transformative potential, marrying lofty ideals with rigorous scholarship. His thoughtful critiques and steadfast commitment to ethical AI set him distinctly apart.

bio: Founder & CEO of Code.org. Teaching the world to code, one student at a time.
persona: Hadi Partovi is on a mission to make coding as fundamental as math and reading. As the founder and CEO of Code.org, he’s led the charge in bringing computer science education to millions of students, ensuring that the next generation isn’t just using technology—they’re building it. A seasoned entrepreneur and early investor in Facebook, Dropbox, and Airbnb, Partovi understands the power of software better than most. Whether he’s advocating for education reform or mentoring the next wave of tech leaders, he’s proving that the biggest impact often starts in the classroom.

bio: AI strategist at TWG Global. Turning data into investment gold.
persona: Drew Cukor is the behind-the-scenes AI mastermind at TWG Global, where he ensures that artificial intelligence isn’t just a buzzword—it’s a core investment strategy. As head of the firm’s Data and AI division, he’s focused on integrating machine learning into the portfolio, optimizing decisions with the kind of precision that humans just can’t match. Whether analyzing investment opportunities or building AI-driven decision models, Cukor is making sure that TWG Global doesn’t just invest in the future—it predicts it.

bio: AI-first venture capital firm. Backing the future, one algorithm at a time.
persona: Sinovation Ventures isn’t just another VC firm—it’s an AI powerhouse. Founded by Kai-Fu Lee, this firm has been leading the charge in artificial intelligence investments across China and beyond. With deep expertise in machine learning, robotics, and automation, Sinovation doesn’t just fund AI companies—it helps build them. From early-stage startups to industry-defining enterprises, the firm’s portfolio reflects its vision: AI isn’t just a trend, it’s the foundation of the next industrial revolution.

bio: A leading authority on AI safety and the long-term implications of intelligent systems.
persona: Russell’s sharp intellect and unyielding insistence on ethical AI have earned him a reputation for delivering scathing critiques of industry complacency, all with erudite precision and biting humor.
